Elliott Educational Services

Educational consulting at the intersection of theory, policy, and practice

Live Preview

Founder and CEO, Takiema Bunche Smith, was in need a website redesign for her educational advocacy and consultancy business that left a lasting impression on her clients and the communities that she serves. Takiema needed a website to display her services, blog posts, and publications; a calendar for her events; and an advertising machine for her videos, keynotes, interviews, and resources; and a place to highlight her many endeavors, like Humanity First, Opt-Out Advocacy, and Stillbirth Support. We worked hand in hand with Takiema to meet her needs and create a beautiful, yet functional website that she could be proud to show her friends, family, and clients.

Meeting Takiema's Needs

A couple of years ago, we created the first Anahsa website. However, it was a bit out of date and needed a facelift. Looking to try something new and easily accesible for her to make changes, we decided to update her website to the most current Squarespace version (7.1) and create a new visually pleasing website that retained the same functionality as the old website.

The website that we had in mind had several must-have features, as well as some added flare. She needed: a blog, resources page, publications and press page with dropdown accordion, dedicated services pages, social media integration, dedicated page for her projects, calendar of all her events, newsletter subscription form, and photos from her latest photo shoot.

Benchmarks & Performance Metrics

After our planning meetings and the finalized content, we had our marching orders for building Takiema an updated website for Anahsa, LLC. With her wishes in mind, we focused on five key areas for her website redesign:

  • An easily updatable calendar for her many events
  • An blog that is easy to maintain and update
  • Helpful dropdown resource and publication tabs to share information and peer-reviewed work
  • Dedicated pages for projects: Humanity First, Opt-Out Advocacy, and Stillbirth Support
  • A platform to advertise latest work and Anahsa, LLC consultants

And we think it came out rather well!
